timeline.message: Merge branch 'branch-2.3' of github.com:Alluxio/alluxio into branch-2.3-fuse
Implement write path for JNIFuse

Make the "MOUNT_POINT" docker env configurable

orig-commit: Alluxio/alluxio@ce2bcb689a2e1b62972771b1b082169f1559f6ea

pr-link: Alluxio/alluxio#11880
change-id: cid-f5402843fcd24b10ff6bff73de5dc45371652350
Add version and revision when starting FUSE
Fix Wasb UFS to respect block size

Prevent adding conf on local start if it exists

Previously, if debug options were enabled on the JVM via java options
like ALLUXIO_MASTER_JAVA_OPTS, then alluxio getConf would not return the
expected result causing `alluxio.master.hostname` to be added to
`alluxio-site.properties` multiple times. This change allows debug
options to be enabled on the JVM without filling up the
alluxio-site.properties with a duplicated line.

There is one catch: If someone has `alluxio.master.hostname` set in
`alluxio-env.sh`, then this would still be added exactly once to the
site properties, but the system property would still take

change-id: cid-159a2cdcf8d35b9481c0f198283c17c46e98c586
Respect gid/uid in getAttr in jniFuse

Add loadMetadata command

We used to have a command `fs loadMetadata`
This PR restores loadMetadata command, but as a client-side optimization
without storing all returned `ls` results, preventing OOM for massive
amount of small files.

This optimization is experimental, going to branch-2.3-fuse only for now

Fix https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio/issues/12088

pr-link: Alluxio/alluxio#12105
change-id: cid-d54b6378eb56292355832456acee65e104322dd4

Support dynamic user to run alluxio

The issue is that alluxio docker image only supports two users: alluxio
and root, but in the customer env, they have more users and the data of
each user are isolated. So we need to make alluxio docker image can
support run container by specifying during running time.

This feature by default is disabled.

pr-link: Alluxio/alluxio#12104
change-id: cid-37cd7ac23075b398b428434f12bf0169710fd3d9
Fix early quit of loadMetadata
Revert change in log4j setting

Support dynamic non-root user for alluxio fuse

pr-link: Alluxio/alluxio#12143
change-id: cid-367014ca1cf96e776544cbb7a1a8aca03d69b40b

[SMALLFIX] Do not trigger async caching on posRead if source is local

Small fix to make posRead behavior mimic normal read behavior. If the
source is local, we have already cached the data. Unfortunately our
testing framework is not fine grained enough to track the RPC calls (see
AlluxioFileInStreamTest#L752).
In general, our strategy of sending async cache requests has been
aggressive because we believed it is cheap for the worker to filter out
duplicate requests. If this is not the case, we can probably further
decrease the number of async cache requests we make.

pr-link: Alluxio/alluxio#11813
change-id: cid-2b2f4e2e636e1abceb955ae065b7dd75877c6491

Fix deadlock of racing worker client acquisition and file completion

Fix bug: fuse pod hang forever if open&read many files without close the
files

Root cause:
`mBlockInStream` in `AlluxioFileInStream` won't be released even reading
to end of the block.
In this case, `BlockWorkerClient` will be held in `BlockInStream`. Given
many files opened, `BlockWorkerClient` in the pool will be exhausted and
the following operations will be blocked.
Fix:
Release `mBlockInStream` after reading to end of the block.

pr-link: Alluxio/alluxio#12139
change-id: cid-34eb4e2af8c68dd0a67a0947a27f95777f8b84f0

Revert "Add support to use a special file to run Alluxio command in fuse"

This reverts commit 5007548bd27188f315080b6a5f55f7fcd9abb299.
Add distributedLoad to Rest API

Add client-side API to iterate on results of listStatus

This PR aims to optimize client-side RPC handling for the case where
master returns a large list of URIStatus.

With the new client-side api added in this patch, client can proceed
with partially transmitted listStatus results, without creating extra
list and wait for all results to complete. This can reduce the memory
pressure and latency when list a large directory.

Other implications

- avoid unnecessary sort in `fs ls` which further reduce memory and
latency.
- also update `distributedLoad` and `count` cli to avoid unnecessary
recursion and able to proceed with partially returned status

pr-link: Alluxio/alluxio#12315
change-id: cid-b345a7588fd4e92380a126261ed4444d3fea71e1
Use iterateStatus for Fuse readdir

Avoid duplicates with metadata caching client on iterateStatus

Fix https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio/issues/12373

pr-link: Alluxio/alluxio#12423
change-id: cid-c86d2fbb28cd904e612cb64166983a21fdd2c3a6

Prevent unnecessary inode syncing

Fix https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio/issues/12372

Before this PR, running
```
bin/alluxio fs ls -Dalluxio.user.file.metadata.sync.interval=0 /path
```
will trigger syncing inodes:
(1) `/path`
(2) `/path/{children}`
(3) `/path/{children}/{children}` (added to pending inode queue when
`InodeSyncStream` traversing (2))

Reading (3) is unnecessary w.r.t. the command we are interested. This PR
check and prevent setting flag `syncChildren` unnecessarily.


In addition, this patch also saves one unnecessary RPC on ls command.

pr-link: Alluxio/alluxio#12441
change-id: cid-d1db929879e7e3a50b4e4a324391f7112dd8ef17
Add Uid and Gid Cache in Fuse

Avoid printing long proto lines in messages and exception descriptions

When printing a request proto as a log message or exception message,
some requests contain large payloads. Those large payloads make it
difficult to inspect the message. This change truncates individual lines
of message.

pr-link: Alluxio/alluxio#12120
change-id: cid-224a09f358e9dee38af8c1131fcc064a14f16576

Log slow remote reads and writes

For worker remote reads and writes, if a particular read or write takes
longer than expected, we log (via the sampling logger) a message to give
a sense of the delays.

pr-link: Alluxio/alluxio#12449
change-id: cid-a2baa04dc4fba7ecd7ff8fafc344e621722fff65

Use longer remote io timeouts to account for slow operations

Some client requests to workers may take a long time, especially if UFS
is involved. In order to avoid spurious errors, the timeout should be
much longer, but we also log a message every minute while the client is
waiting.

pr-link: Alluxio/alluxio#12463
change-id: cid-8f2f692aa34b73f134295d906915040f66208296

Improve concurrent read performance through RPC

Target to fix #12146
Two improvements:
1) When multiple processes/threads accessing the same blocks
concurrently, same data will be read only once with SharedDataReader.
SharedDataReader buffers blocks on the client side. It will buffer a
block from index 0 to the biggest index being read. Only when no
processes/threads accessing this block will the block buffer being
removed.
2) Seek(pos) improvements. Previously close and reopen DataReader
introduce many overheads. The improvements look like target to reduce
the DataReader reopen. When reading backward, SharedDataReader can
directly read from local cache. when reading forward, instead of doing
seek(), the BlockInStream will try to read data already received but not
processed to reach the target pos.

Serveral TODOs/improvements
Seek in DataBuffer instead of data copy while seeking inner a chunk
SharedDataReader locking
Add memory limits for shared data buffer.

Co-authored-by: Lu Qiu <luqiujob@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: This property is unused, can it be removed? The description is not very clear as well
timeline.author: LuQQiu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -4346,6 +4365,30 @@ public String toString() {
           .setConsistencyCheckLevel(ConsistencyCheckLevel.IGNORE)
           .setScope(Scope.CLIENT)
           .build();
+  public static final PropertyKey FUSE_JNIFUSE_ENABLED =
+      new Builder(Name.FUSE_JNIFUSE_ENABLED)
+          .setDefaultValue(true)
+          .setDescription("Use experimental JNIFUSE library for better performance.")
+          .setConsistencyCheckLevel(ConsistencyCheckLevel.IGNORE)
+          .setScope(Scope.CLIENT)
+          .build();
+  public static final PropertyKey FUSE_SHARED_CACHING_READER_ENABLED =
+      new Builder(Name.FUSE_SHARED_CACHING_READER_ENABLED)
+          .setDefaultValue(false)
+          .setDescription("(Experimental) Use share grpc data reader for better performance "
+              + "on multi-process file reading through Alluxio JNI Fuse. "
+              + "Blocks data will be cached on the client side "
+              + "so more memory is required for the Fuse process.")
+          .setConsistencyCheckLevel(ConsistencyCheckLevel.IGNORE)
+          .setScope(Scope.CLIENT)
+          .build();
+  public static final PropertyKey FUSE_MAXCACHE_BYTES =

timeline.bodyText: Is this a bug to get a null client?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: I think this is to prevent nullptr when USER_DIRECT_MEMORY_IO_ENABLED
replies.author: apc999

timeline.bodyText: Is this ((blockSize > (chunkSize * 4)) some heuristic? What is the thinking behind this?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText:
yes this is a heuristic motivated by tests done by MSFT and verified & contributed by them too.
essentially, for concurrent reads for the same large file through FUSE, the reads likely ended up at different FileInputStream, and introduce frequent blockInStream construction & destruction, causing performance down by 100x.
this fix can effectively mitigate this issue. Note that, this heuristic is always guarded by the flag. More comments added
replies.author: apc999

timeline.bodyText: I think this comment is confusing? The flag is about using the shared grpc reader, so this comment is talking about a fuse flag.
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: clarified.
replies.author: apc999

timeline.bodyText:
This block looks like the seek logic for when we are NOT using the shared grpc reader. Is there a reason why we cannot just have 2 types of seek logic (1) using shared grpc reader, (2) without shared grpc reader?
Instead, we have 3 types of seek logic now.
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText:
put the newly added two seek logic separately guarded by the flag.
in this way we introduce minimal change to existing codepath
replies.author: apc999

replies.bodyText: I changed the code a bit. so this code path is only executed when mDataReader instanceof SharedGrpcDataReader
replies.author: apc999

replies.bodyText: toptier. name changed
replies.author: apc999

timeline.bodyText:
It is strange to me that something called BufferCachingGrpcDataReader is not implementing DataReader. Is there a reason for that?
Also, is a unittest possible for this?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText:
I asked the same question in its PR and the author said it is very different from other DataReader, indicating it does not make sense to inherit DataReader.
Let's aim to add test in #12474 too
replies.author: apc999

timeline.bodyText: Is a unittest possible for this?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: it is in a separate PR, not merged yet #12474
replies.author: apc999

timeline.bodyText: Would it be useful for this to be configurable?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: I don't think this value needs to be configured
replies.author: apc999

timeline.bodyText: Can you explain why we need external locks (BLOCK_LOCKS) when we are using a ConcurrentHashMap? What is the block lock protecting?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText:
block lock is used to ensure thread-safety when referencing or updating the shared data reader for block i in different fileinstream
ConcurrentHashMap is store the map from block i to the shared data reader, as different fileinstream may handle different blocks at the same time

I added more javadoc on the locking scheme
replies.author: apc999

timeline.bodyText:
There is no "hashing" happening to the block id. block ids are a concatenation of 2 numbers: <container id>:<sequence number>. For all files, the first block of the file will always start with sequence number 0. That means the first block of every file may always hash to the the same block lock, the second block of all files will be the next block, and so on. There would be a pattern.
Is behavior ok? I would imagine that we would want a more "random" distribution of the block locks?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: good catch! Added a hash func to distribute the lock
replies.author: apc999

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure what this means. Does this mean this reader is always going to be ready?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: removed
replies.author: apc999

timeline.bodyText:
This makes is sound like this is just like the normal grpc data reader, but just caches the data.
If that is the case, why can't we just add caching option to the grpc data reader? Or, wrap the existing grpc data reader? This looks like a reimplementation, with caching functionality.
Also, could you briefly describe the relationship between this BufferCachingGrpcDataReader and SharedGrpcDataReader ?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText:
what you described is correct. We choose to reimplement to ensure no existing code path is modified.
SharedGrpcDataReader is re-using existing DataReaders to reduce the cost on creation and close.
BufferCachingGrpcDataReader is providing the caching function.
